page.title: 19SHOTESHAM/HOWE TRANSPORT
page.content: {PUBLIC TRANSPORT}Shotesham is served by a local coach company, 6 services to Norwich daily. No service after 1800hrs or on Sundays. Howe is without a service. {PRIVATE TRANSPORT}a. Business: Most families use a car for travel to work. Local industries use tractors,lorries etc. b. Social/Leisure: Again the car affords convenient family travel. Bicycles are used by many, young and old for village and intervillage travel. Mopeds are used by a few. { {ROADS}Unclassified, being an average width of 4.8m, and country lanes intersect the area. 2 of the lanes have a permanent ford when crossed by the Beck. The lanes have descriptive names i.e. Market Lane, Wash Lane, damp underfoot and Sewell's Lane. Small Lanes are called Lokes.
